meanings.definition: To force out of a proper vessel or channel
meanings.sent1: The overflowing river can extravasate onto the nearby fields.
meanings.sent2: The water bottle extravasated its contents when it fell.
meanings.sent3: The ketchup bottle decided to extravasate all over the table during dinner.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions began to extravasate, spilling out uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: The balloon started to extravasate air, slowly deflating.

meanings.definition: To exude or pass out of a vessel into surrounding tissues
meanings.sent1: The wound may extravasate blood if not treated promptly.
meanings.sent2: The plant's leaves can extravasate a sticky sap when touched.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing cup of coffee seemed to extravasate all over the counter.
meanings.sent4: His creativity seemed to extravasate from his mind onto the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh flowers seemed to extravasate throughout the room.
